```{r setup}
library(rtackhmmer)
library(dplyr)
```

Yoooooo, let's parse some `hmmer` output, specifically that generated by the command `hmmsearch --tblout <outfile>`.

```{r, warning=FALSE}
single_search_result <- parse_badly("extdata/3300025587_25.tblout.scan")
glimpse(single_search_result)
```

This throws a bunch of warnings. I don't know why, but it does appear to work!

We can also call `parse_directory_badly()` to parse all the files in a directory, and concatenate them into one data frame.

```{r, warning=FALSE}
all_search_results <- parse_directory_badly("extdata/")
glimpse(all_search_results)
```
